original: 4. Bodhisattadhammatāpañha🔽“Bhante nāgasena, bhāsitampetaṁ bhagavatā dhammatādhammapariyāye ‘pubbeva bodhisattānaṁ🔽mātāpitaro niyatā honti, bodhi niyatā hoti, aggasāvakā niyatā honti, putto niyato
analyzed: bhante nāgasena bhāsitam petam bhagavatā dhammatā dhamma pariyāye pubbā iva bodhisattāna  mātā pitaraḥ niyatāḥ honti bodhi niyatā hoti aggasāvakāḥ niyatāḥ honti puttaḥ niyataḥ
translated: The Question about the Nature of a Bodhisatta

original: hoti, upaṭṭhāko niyato hotī’ti.
analyzed: hoti upaṭṭhākaḥ niyataḥ hoti iti
translated: “Though, revered Nāgasena, this was said by the Blessed One in the Dhamma Discourse on the Nature of Things: ‘The parents of the Bodhisattas are fixed, the tree of enlightenment is fixed, the chief disciples are fixed, the son and the principal attendant are fixed,’

original: Puna ca tumhe bhaṇatha—🔽‘tusite kāye ṭhito bodhisatto aṭṭha mahāvilokanāni viloketi, kālaṁ viloketi, dīpaṁ🔽viloketi, desaṁ viloketi, kulaṁ viloketi, janettiṁ viloketi, āyuṁ viloketi, māsaṁ
analyzed: puna ca tumhe bhaṇatha  tusite kāye ṭhitaḥ bodhisattaḥ aṭṭha mahā vilokanāni viloketi kālam viloketi dīpa  viloka iti desam viloka iti kulam viloka iti janettim viloka iti āyum viloka iti māsa
translated: and again you say:

original: viloketi, nekkhammaṁ viloketī’ti.
analyzed: viloketi nekkhammam viloketi iti
translated: ‘The Bodhisatta, standing in the Tusita heaven, surveys the ten great matters, he surveys the time, he surveys the island, he surveys the country, he surveys the family, he surveys the mother, he surveys his life-span, he surveys the month, he surveys his renunciation.’

original: Bhante nāgasena, aparipakke ñāṇe bujjhanaṁ natthi, paripakke ñāṇe na sakkā nimesantarampi āgametuṁ, anatikkamanīyaṁ paripakkamānasaṁ.
analyzed: bhante nāgasena a paripakke ñāṇe bujjhanam natthi paripakke ñāṇe na sakkā nimesa antaram pi āgametu an atikkamanīyam paripakka mānasa
translated: Revered Nāgasena, there is no awakening without the ripening of knowledge, and when the knowledge is ripe it is not possible to delay it even for the winking of an eye, the mind that is ripe cannot be turned back.

original: Kasmā bodhisatto kālaṁ viloketi ‘kamhi kāle uppajjāmī’ti.
analyzed: kasmai bodhisatto kālam kamhi kāle uppajjāmi iti
translated: Why does the Bodhisatta survey the time, ‘In what time shall I arise?’”

original: Aparipakke ñāṇe bujjhanaṁ natthi, paripakke ñāṇe na sakkā nimesantarampi āgametuṁ, kasmā bodhisatto kulaṁ viloketi ‘kamhi kule uppajjāmī’ti.
analyzed: a paripakke ñāṇe bujjhanam natthi paripakke ñāṇe na sakkā nimesa antaram pi āgametu kasmā bodhisatto kulam viloketi kamhi kule uppajjāmi iti
translated: “When the knowledge is not ripe, there is no awakening; when the knowledge is ripe, one cannot wait even the twinkling of an eye. Why did the Bodhisatta look at the family, thinking, ‘In what family shall I be reborn?’”

original: Yadi, bhante nāgasena, pubbeva bodhisattassa mātāpitaro niyatā, tena hi ‘kulaṁ viloketī’ti yaṁ vacanaṁ, taṁ micchā.
analyzed: yadi bhante nāgasena pubbā iva bodhisattassa mātā pitaraḥ niyatā tena hi kulam viloketi iti yam tam micchā
translated: “If, revered sir, the parents of the Bodhisatta were already fixed, then the statement that ‘he looked at the family’ is wrong.

original: Yadi kulaṁ viloketi, tena hi ‘pubbeva bodhisattassa mātāpitaro niyatā’ti tampi vacanaṁ micchā.
analyzed: yadi kulam tena hi pubbā iva bodhisattassa mātā pitaro niyatā ati tam pi vacanam micchā
translated: If he looked at the family, then the statement that ‘the parents of the Bodhisatta were already fixed’ is wrong.

original: Ayampi ubhato koṭiko pañho tavānuppatto, so tayā nibbāhitabbo”ti.
analyzed: ayam pi ubhatas koṭikaḥ pañho tava anuppatto saḥ tayā nibbāhitabbaḥ ti
translated: This too is a double-pronged question; it is put to you; it is for you to solve.”

original: “Niyatā, mahārāja, pubbeva bodhisattassa mātāpitaro, kulañca bodhisatto viloketi.
analyzed: niyatāḥ mahā rāja pubbā iva bodhisattassa mātā pitaro kulam ca bodhisattaḥ viloketi
translated: “The parents of the Bodhisatta, sire, were already fixed, but the Bodhisatta looked at the family.

original: Kinti pana kulaṁ viloketi ‘ye me mātāpitaro, te khattiyā udāhu brāhmaṇā’ti.
analyzed: kinti pana kulam ye me mātā pitaro te khattiyāḥ udāhu brāhmaṇa ati
translated: But how did he look at the family, thinking, ‘Are my parents nobles or brahmans’?

original: Evaṁ kulaṁ viloketi.
analyzed: evam kulam
translated: Thus he looked at the family.

original: Aṭṭhannaṁ, mahārāja, pubbeva anāgataṁ oloketabbaṁ hoti.
analyzed: mahā rāja pubbā iva anāgatam oloketabbam hoti
translated: Eight things, sire, must be looked at in the future.

original: Katamesaṁ aṭṭhannaṁ?
analyzed: katamesam aṭṭhan na
translated: What eight?

original: Vāṇijassa, mahārāja, pubbeva vikkayabhaṇḍaṁ oloketabbaṁ hoti, hatthināgassa pubbeva🔽soṇḍāya anāgato maggo oloketabbo hoti, sākaṭikassa pubbeva anāgataṁ titthaṁ oloketabbaṁ🔽hoti, niyāmakassa pubbeva anāgataṁ tīraṁ oloketvā nāvā pesetabbā hoti, bhisakkassa🔽pubbeva āyuṁ oloketvā āturo upasaṅkamitabbo hoti, uttarasetussa pubbeva thirāthirabhāvaṁ🔽jānitvā abhiruhitabbaṁ hoti, bhikkhussa pubbeva anāgataṁ kālaṁ paccavekkhitvā bhojanaṁ
analyzed: vāṇijassa mahā rāja pubbā iva vikkaya bhaṇḍam oloketabbam hoti hatthi nāgassa pubbā iva  soṇḍāya anāgataḥ maggaḥ oloketabbaḥ hoti sākaṭikassa pubbā iva anāgatam tittham oloketabba  hoti niyāmakassa pubbā iva anāgatam tīram oloketvā nāvā pesetabbā hoti bhisakkassa  pubbā iva āyum oloketvā āturaḥ upasaṅkamitabbaḥ hoti uttara setussa pubbā iva thira a thira bhāva  jānitvā abhiruhitabbam hoti bhikkhussa pubbā iva anāgatam kālam paccavekkhitvā bhojana
translated: The merchant, sire, must first examine the wares he is going to sell; the elephant must first🔽examine with his trunk the path that lies ahead; the carter must first examine the road that lies ahead;🔽the helmsman must first examine the ford and then set out; the physician must first examine the patient’s life-span and then go to him;🔽the bridge-builder must first examine the near and the far bank and then build the bridge; the bhikkhu must first examine the time that lies ahead and then eat his food.

original: bhuñjitabbaṁ hoti, bodhisattānaṁ pubbeva kulaṁ oloketabbaṁ hoti ‘khattiyakulaṁ vā
analyzed: bhuñjitabbam hoti bodhisattānam pubbā iva kulam oloketabbam hoti khattiya kulam vā
translated: The merchant, sire, must first examine the goods he is going to sell; the elephant must first examine the path he is going to travel with his trunk; the carter must first examine the road he is going to travel; the boatman must first examine the ford and then send his boat on; the physician must first examine the life-span of the patient and then attend him; the bridge-builder must first examine the river to see whether it is fordable or not and then build the bridge; the monk must first examine the time and then eat his food; the Bodhisatta must first examine the family, whether it is of Khattiya or

original: brāhmaṇakulaṁ vā’ti.
analyzed: brāhmaṇa kulam vāti
translated: Brahmana rank.

original: Imesaṁ kho, mahārāja, aṭṭhannaṁ pubbeva anāgataṁ oloketabbaṁ hotī”ti.
analyzed: imesam kho mahā rāja aṭṭhannam pubbā iva anāgatam oloketabbam hoti iti
translated: These eight, sire, must first examine the future.”

original: “Sādhu, bhante nāgasena, evametaṁ tathā sampaṭicchāmī”ti.
analyzed: sādhu bhante nāgasena evam etam tathā sampaṭicchāmi iti
translated: “Excellent, revered Nāgasena; so it is, therefore do I accept this speech.”

original: Bodhisattadhammatāpañho catuttho.
analyzed: bodhisatta dhammatā pañho catuttho
translated: The fourth chapter.
